result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen L. Gholson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions (cases 16CF79, 15CF92, and 15CM132 concurrent with each other):  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete domestic violence class.  Perform 10 hours of community service.  0 days credit in the event of revocation.

Court imposes costs for count 2 but remits them/waives them for count 4.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
10:05 a.m.  Defendant Allen L. Gholson in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank. Prosecuting Atty Timothy James Gaskell appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin in 15CM197/sentencing after revocation.  ADA Amy Forehand appears for the State of Wisconsin for 15CM132/sentencing after revocation, 15CF92/sentencing after revocation, 16CF79/sentencing after revocation, and 17CM23 and 16CM160/adjourned initial.

DA Gaskell addresses the Court in 15CM197.  ADA Forehand addresses the Court in the other sentencing after rev cases.  Atty. Frank addresses the Court.  Def addresses the Court.

Sentence after revocation: 

15CM197 - Count 1 and 2, both battery:  9 months year jail both counts, concurrent.  

15CF92 - Counts 2 (disorderly conduct) and 4 (bail jumping):  Count 2 - 90 days, consecutive to Counts 1 and 2 of 15CM197; Count 4 - 9 months concurrent with all other charges

15CM132 - Count 2, criminal damage to property with d.a. enhancer:  9 months concurrent with all other charges

16CF79 - Count 1, bail jumping:  9 months concurrent with all other charges.

Credit:  52 days credit on everything except for Count 2 of 15CM92.

Costs have already been imposed; any remaining now as civil judgment.

Adjourned initials in 17CM23 and 16CM160 - formal reading waived.  NG previously entered in 16CM160; entered now also in 17CM23, def having stood mute.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Status requested and set for 3/29 at 9:00.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 10, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Several cases called together, four of them subject to revocation:  16CF79, 15CM197, 15CM132, and 15CF92.  Also called:  new filing 17CM23 and adjourned initial 16CM160. 

In 15CM197, special prosecutor Tim Gaskell appears by phone for the State.  In all of the other cases, ADA Forehand appears for the State.  Defendant appears in custody for all matters, appearing today without counsel.  It has been noted that Def is presently without counsel while SPD looks for an attorney who can take the cases despite numerous conflicts between the cases and co-defendants.  

Def states that he wants to proceed to sentencing after rev in the 4 revoked cases.  ADA Forehand notes rev order/warrant just came through; State is not prepared to go forward with sentencing today.  

Court resets all matters to 2/10 at 10.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for February 10, 2017 at 10:00 am.
scheduling correspondence between clerk and counsel re SAR calendaring
Status conference on February 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.

ADA Amy Forehand for the State, Defendant and Atty. Dominic Anderson for the Defense.  15TR1964, 15CF92, 15CM132, and 16CF79 called together.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution.  Atty. Anderson details the agreement.  Def pleads no contest to Counts 2 and 4 in 15CF92, Count 2 in 15CM132, and Count 1 as amended to misdemeanor in 16CF79.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Sentence:  withheld for 2 years probation.  Conditions:  2 sets of costs imposed (costs to be imposed on the counts with d.a. enhancer).  Attend, pay for, and succ. complete d.v. class.  Perform 10 hrs community service.  No restitution requested.  0 days credit in the event of revocation.  Atty. Anderson asks for assignment of $500 in 16CF79 with remaining $500 to be returned to poster; so ordered. 

Remaining counts dismissed/read-in.
